rights.description: Must respond within 7 business days by making records available, denying request in writing, or providing estimated timeframe
rights.implementation_notes: Agency must take one of three actions: produce, deny, or estimate timeline
rights.request_tips: Track business days - agency must respond within 7 days with action or timeline

rights.description: May charge for labor only after first hour of work
rights.conditions: First hour of search/compilation is free
rights.implementation_notes: Protects against fees for routine requests
rights.request_tips: First hour of agency work is free - only charged if exceeds 60 minutes

rights.description: Inspection is free of charge - no fees for viewing records
rights.conditions: No inspection fees under any circumstances
rights.implementation_notes: Only copy fees apply, not inspection
rights.request_tips: Request in-person inspection to avoid all fees

rights.description: Cost estimates must be provided before charging fees
rights.request_tips: Demand cost estimate in writing before agency begins billable work

rights.description: Attorney's fees may be awarded for willful violations
rights.request_tips: If denial appears willful, attorney fees recoverable in litigation

rights.description: Court may assess costs against government for improper denials
rights.request_tips: If improperly denied, court may order government to pay costs

rights.description: Government bears burden of proof for denials
rights.implementation_notes: Requester does not need to prove entitlement
rights.request_tips: Agency must prove exemption applies - you don't have to justify request

rights.description: Each governmental entity must designate Public Records Request Coordinator (PRRC)
rights.request_tips: Direct requests to designated PRRC for faster response

rights.description: Each entity must have written public records policy
rights.request_tips: Request copy of entity's written public records policy

rights.description: Office of Open Records Counsel provides guidance and dispute assistance
rights.conditions: Available to all requesters and agencies
rights.request_tips: Contact Office of Open Records Counsel (Comptroller's Office) for guidance

rights.description: May submit requests via email, online, or other electronic methods
rights.request_tips: Submit electronically for documentation and faster delivery

rights.description: Records with confidential information must be redacted; redacted records made available for inspection
rights.conditions: Applies when record contains both public and confidential information
rights.implementation_notes: Cannot withhold entire record if only portion is confidential
rights.request_tips: If denied, demand redaction of confidential portions rather than total withholding

rights.description: Courts instructed to give citizens fullest possible public access
rights.implementation_notes: Creates strong presumption in favor of disclosure
rights.request_tips: Cite mandate for 'fullest possible public access' when challenging denials

rights.description: All records open during business hours unless otherwise provided by law
rights.request_tips: Request in-person inspection during business hours

validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Tennessee has strong requester protections including: 7 business day response requirement, first hour of work free, free inspection, cost estimates required, attorney fees for willful violations, burden of proof on government, PRRC required, Office of Open Records Counsel oversight, and mandate for 'fullest possible public access.' NOTE: Tennessee has residency requirement (citizens only).
